title: Large Inflow of Money Witnessed in S&T Bancorp, Inc.
text:
Large Inflow of Money Witnessed in S&T Bancorp, Inc. September 9, 2015 by Kevin Winslow in Market Indices Â· 0 Comment 
Shares of S&T Bancorp, Inc. (NASDAQ:STBA) saw an erosion of -0.09 points in recent session. During the trading, the value of each share was $29.55, dropping -0.3%. The shares saw high fund-flow as the composite value of all the upticks was $1.01 million and the total value of all the downticks was a mere $0.65 million. The net money flow was seen at $0.36 million and the up/down ratio was measured at 1.56. On a weekly basis the shares of the shares have recorded a change of -0.3%. 
Currently the company Insiders own 2.8% of S&T Bancorp Inc. Company shares. In the past six months, there is a change of -13.76% in the total insider ownership. Institutional Investors own 48% of Company shares. During last 3 month period, 4.23% of total institutional ownership has changed in the company shares. On a different note, The Company has disclosed insider buying and selling activities to the Securities Exchange, Gibson James Thomas, director of S&T Bancorp Inc, unloaded 25,000 shares at an average price of $31.3 on July 24, 2015. The total amount of the transaction was worth $782,500, according to the disclosed information with the Securities and Exchange Commission in a Form 4 filing. 
Many analysts have commented on the company rating. Equity Analysts at the Keefe Bruyette & Woods maintains the rating on S&T Bancorp, Inc. (NASDAQ:STBA). The brokerage firm has issued a Outperform rating on the shares. The Analysts at the ratings agency raises the price target from $31 per share to $33 per share. The rating by the firm was issued on July 22, 2015. 
As many as 5 brokerage firms have rated S&T Bancorp, Inc. (NASDAQ:STBA) at 2.8. Research Analysts at Zacks have ranked the company at 3, suggesting the traders with a rating of hold for the short term. The stock garnered a place in the hold list of 4 stock Analysts. 1 analysts suggested buying the shares. 
S&T Bancorp, Inc. (NASDAQ:STBA) witnessed a decline in the market cap on Tuesday as its shares dropped 0.3% or 0.09 points. After the session commenced at $30.07, the stock reached the higher end at $30.07 while it hit a low of $29.33. With the volume soaring to 137,380 shares, the last trade was called at $29.55. The company has a 52-week high of $32.88. The company has a market cap of $1,029 million and there are 34,812,000 shares in outstanding. The 52-week low of the share price is $23.07. 
S&T Bancorp, Inc. (S&T) is a bank holding company and has three wholly owned subsidiaries, S&T Bank, 9th Street Holdings, Inc. and STBA Capital Trust I. The Company also owns certain interest in Commonwealth Trust Credit Life Insurance Company. As of December 31, 2012, the Company had approximately $3.4 billion in loans and $3.6 billion in deposits. S&T Bank is a full service bank. It provides its services to its customers through offices located in Allegheny, Armstrong, Blair, Butler, Cambria, Clarion, Clearfield, Indiana, Jefferson and Westmoreland counties of Pennsylvania. It operates in three segments: Community Banking, Wealth Management and Insurance. Its Community Banking segment offers services, which include accepting time and demand deposit accounts, originating commercial and consumer loans, and providing letters of credit and credit card services. The Wealth Management segment offers discount brokerage services, services as executor and trustee under wills and deeds.
